avalancheActivity.highlights: Beware of numerous exposed rocks hidden by the little recent snow.
avalancheActivity.comment: As a consequence of highly fluctuating temperatures the snow drift accumulations stabilised. They can be released in isolated cases and generally at high altitude, especially adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas, and at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example, in particular on extremely steep slopes.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions a little snow is lying. The sometimes strong wind has transported the new snow.
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2200 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. On steep sunny slopes below approximately 2600 m a little snow is lying. At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is now lying.
Weak layers exist in the old snowpack in all aspects.
As a consequence of highly fluctuating temperatures and solar radiation a crust formed on the surface, in particular below approximately 2700 m on very steep sunny slopes.

tendency.highlights: Wind and new snow: The avalanche danger will increase during the day.

regions.name: B - VALLI DI GRESSONEY, AYAS, CHAMPORCHER

avalancheActivity.highlights: Weak layers in the old snowpack can still be released in isolated cases. On very steep sunny slopes crampons are useful
avalancheActivity.comment:
Weak layers exist in the snowpack on shady slopes. Avalanches can be released by people. Caution is to be exercised in particular on extremely steep slopes, and at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example.
The more recent wind slabs are to be found at high altitude, caution is to be exercised in particular along the border with Switzerland.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Sunshine and high temperatures gave rise to increasing moistening of the snowpack in particular on very steep sunny slopes in particular at low and intermediate altitudes. As a consequence of highly fluctuating temperatures and solar radiation a crust formed on the surface, in particular below approximately 2700 m. These conditions facilitated a strengthening of the near-surface layers in particular on sunny slopes.

Shady slopes: The snowpack is dry and has a loosely bonded surface.
Weak layers exist in the old snowpack in all aspects.
Snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2400 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitude a little snow is lying. At low and intermediate altitudes less snow than usual is lying.

tendency.highlights: As a consequence of new snow and wind there will be only a slight increase in the danger.

avalancheActivity.highlights: On very steep sunny slopes crampons are useful
avalancheActivity.comment:
As the temperature drops hardly any more moist and wet avalanches are possible. Individual gliding avalanches can also be released in the night or in the morning, in particular on extremely steep grassy slopes below approximately 2700 m. Field observations and natural avalanches confirm this situation. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided as far as possible.

The sometimes moderate wind has transported the old snow. The mostly small wind slabs of Tuesday can be released by a single winter sport participant in isolated cases at high altitude, in particular at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example in particular in high Alpine regions.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Sunshine and high temperatures gave rise to increasing moistening of the snowpack in particular on very steep sunny slopes in particular at low and intermediate altitudes. As a consequence of falling temperatures a crust formed on the surface. These conditions facilitated a strengthening of the near-surface layers in particular on sunny slopes, in particular below approximately 2700 m.
Shady slopes: The snowpack is dry and has a loosely bonded surface.
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2400 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitude a little snow is lying.

tendency.highlights: A little new snow: In these regions there will be only a very slight increase in the danger.
